devdoc.author: Stability Labs Pty. Ltd.
devdoc.details: The Nexus is mStable's Kernel, and allows the publishing and propagating         of new system Modules. Other Modules will read from the Nexus

acceptProposedModule(bytes32).details: Accept and publish an already proposed module

acceptProposedModules(bytes32[]).details: Accept and publish already proposed modules

cancelGovernorChange().details: Cancels an outstanding governor change request by resetting request time

claimGovernorChange().details: Proposed governor claims new position, callable after time elapsed

constructor.details: Initialises the Nexus and adds the core data to the Kernel (itself and governor)

getModule(bytes32).return: Return the address of the module

governor().details: Returns the address of the current Governor.

initialize(bytes32[],address[],bool[],ad.details: Adds multiple new modules to the system to initialize the     Nexus contract with default modules. This should be called first     after deploying Nexus contract.

params._addresses: Contract addresses of the new modules
params._isLocked: IsLocked flag for the new modules
params._keys: Keys of the new modules in bytes32 form

initialize(bytes32[],address[],bool[],ad.return: bool         Success of publishing new Modules

isGovernor().details: Returns true if the caller is the current Governor.

lockModule(bytes32).details: Permanently lock a module to its current settings

moduleExists(bytes32).return: Returns 'true' when a module exists, otherwise 'false'

proposeModule(bytes32,address).details: Propose a new or update existing module

requestGovernorChange(address).details: Requests change of governor and logs request time

requestLockModule(bytes32).details: Request to lock an existing module

devdoc.title: Nexus

userdoc.notice: Address provider and system kernel, also facilitates governance changes
